Detailed Description

Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when a key event is dispatched to this dialog.

The callback will be invoked before the key event is given to the dialog.

The following example demonstrates how to use the IDialogOnKeyListener. 

  //You need implement your owner OnKey Listener for Dialog
  class MyDialogOnKeyListener : gaia::core::IDialogOnKeyListener {
    public:
      MyDialogOnKeyListener();
      virtual ~MyDialogOnKeyListener();
      virtual void onKey(int keycode, int keyaction);
  };

  void MyDialogOnKeyListener::onKey(int keycode, int keyaction) {
      //When pressing Key, it will use the callback to notify you.
      if (keycode == gaia::core::KeyEvent::KEYCODE_BACK) {
          switch (keyaction) {
              case gaia::core::KeyEvent::ACTION_DOWN:
                  //Back Key is pressed!!!
                  break;
              case gaia::core::KeyEvent::ACTION_UP:
                  //Back Key is released!!!
                  break;
              Default:
                  . . .
                  break;
          }
      }
  }

  //In your dialog, just register the callback by registerOnKeyListener
  MyDialogBox* dialog = new MyDialogBox(page);
  MyDialogOnKeyListener* listener = new MyDialogOnKeyListener();
  if (listener == NULL) {
      //DialogOnKeyListener create failure!!
      return;
  }

  if (dialog != NULL) {
    dialog->registerOnKeyListener(listener);
  }
